technique_name: Pán Tuì Píng Héng (Front Cross Legged Balance)
deduction_content: Thigh of supporting leg is not at horizontal level

questions.question: What is the error code for Pán Tuì Píng Héng (Front Cross Legged Balance)?
What is the main deduction point for Pán Tuì Píng Héng?
questions.answer: A deduction is applied when the thigh of supporting leg is not at horizontal level.

questions.question: What is the correct thigh position for the supporting leg in Pán Tuì Píng Héng?
questions.answer: The thigh of the supporting leg must be at horizontal level.

questions.question: How should the legs be positioned in Pán Tuì Píng Héng?
questions.answer: One leg is the supporting leg with the thigh at horizontal level, while the other leg is crossed in front of it.

questions.question: Why is this technique called 'Front Cross Legged Balance'?
questions.answer: Because one leg is crossed in front of the supporting leg while maintaining balance on the supporting leg.
